abstracts.cdata!:
The Transport Sector Adjustment Project
            is a hybrid policy and investment program intended to
            support within the transport sector the objectives of the
            ongoing macro-economic adjustment program. The principal
            objective of the project is to reduce both the cost and the
            price of transport in Chad. To do this, the credit will
            assist: (i) the rehabilitation of 1800 km of priority roads
            drawn from the donor-supported Transport Sector Investment
            Plan 1988 - 93; (ii) improvements in resource mobilization
            and allocation in the transport sector in order to secure
            adequate maintenance of the rehabilitated network; (iii) the
            abolition of the existing monopoly and administered tariffs
            in order to reduce the cost of trucking operations, pass
            vehicle operating cost savings on to shippers and elicit a
            supply response from the productive sectors of the economy;
            (iv) promotion of increased competition and greater role of
            the private sector in the road construction industry; and
            (v) strengthening of the public administration of the
            transport sector.
